intro: Dortmanna eckloniana, commonly known as the Cape primrose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in spring and summer. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
